observations.content: KnowledgePersistencePattern is implemented across: src/knowledge-management, lib/ukb-unified, integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src
Core components: GraphKnowledgeExporter, PersistenceAgent
shared-memory.json has been REMOVED from the codebase
Knowledge storage uses Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph
JSON exports are at .data/knowledge-export (auto-synced from GraphDB)
Knowledge persistence uses GraphDatabaseService (Graphology in-memory + LevelDB persistence)
GraphKnowledgeExporter listens to entity:stored events and auto-exports to JSON at .data/knowledge-export
Pattern extracted from codebase analysis and stored as reusable knowledge entity
KnowledgePersistencePattern is part of the semantic analysis and knowledge management infrastructure
KnowledgePersistencePattern implementation details pending full codebase analysis
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/KnowledgePersistencePattern.md

Knowledge management system spans three main modules: core logic in src/knowledge-management, unified libraries in lib/ukb-unified, and semantic analysis integration in integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src
Storage architecture uses Graphology + LevelDB for primary knowledge graph at .data/knowledge-graph with automated JSON export sync to .data/knowledge-export
Three primary commands available: 'vkb' for knowledge base visualization, 'coding' for development operations, and 'graph-sync' for database synchronization

Core components include GraphDatabaseService for data operations, GraphKnowledgeExporter for data export, GraphDatabaseAdapter for abstraction layer, PersistenceAgent for storage management, and VkbApiClient for API interactions
Recent architectural improvements include parallel worker implementation for batch semantic analysis and removal of shared-memory.json in favor of graph-based storage
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/Coding.md

UkbCli is implemented across: src/knowledge-management, lib/ukb-unified, integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src
Core components: VkbApiClient
shared-memory.json has been REMOVED from the codebase
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/UkbCli.md

The VkbCli implements a dual-storage architecture with Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph for primary storage and auto-synchronized JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export, orchestrated through three main CLI commands: vkb, coding, and graph-sync.

Core components include GraphDatabaseService for business logic, GraphDatabaseAdapter for data access abstraction, PersistenceAgent for storage operations, VkbApiClient for external interactions, and GraphKnowledgeExporter for JSON export functionality to .data/knowledge-export directory.

Recent development activity focuses on performance improvements with parallel workers for batch semantic analysis, constraint optimization for incremental content handling in edit/write operations, and visual project activity indicators, while the shared-memory.json component has been deprecated and removed from the system.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/VkbCli.md

CollectiveKnowledge implements a hybrid storage architecture using Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph for primary storage, with automated JSON exports synchronized to .data/knowledge-export for external access

Knowledge management operations utilize three core commands (vkb, coding, graph-sync) and are supported by GraphDatabaseService, GraphKnowledgeExporter, GraphDatabaseAdapter, PersistenceAgent, and VkbApiClient components distributed across src/knowledge-management and lib/ukb-unified directories
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/CollectiveKnowledge.md

Knowledge management system spans three core modules: src/knowledge-management for domain logic, lib/ukb-unified for shared utilities, and integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src for analysis services
Storage architecture uses Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph with auto-synchronized JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export via GraphKnowledgeExporter component
Recent parallel worker implementation enables batch mode semantic analysis, integrated with existing GraphDatabaseService and PersistenceAgent components
System enforces incremental content constraints only on edit/write operations, with update classification handled by semantic analysis pipeline
Command interface provides vkb for visualization, coding for development tasks, and graph-sync for data synchronization across GraphDatabaseAdapter layer
Architectural evolution tracking uses VkbApiClient for external integrations while maintaining local knowledge persistence through established GraphDatabaseService patterns
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/ArchitecturalEvolutionPattern.md

The system uses Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph for primary graph storage with verified components GraphDatabaseService, GraphKnowledgeExporter, and GraphDatabaseAdapter managing the data layer
Recent parallel worker implementation for batch mode semantic analysis indicates performance optimization efforts, with active bug fixes for insight generation and PlantUML generation agents
The system provides CLI access through vkb command for visualization and graph-sync command for synchronization, with MCP server integration at integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src
Auto-synchronized JSON exports are maintained at .data/knowledge-export directory, removing dependency on the previously used shared-memory.json approach
Current architecture shows component reference issues and stale observations, indicating need for improved dependency management and documentation synchronization
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/SemanticAnalysisAgentSystemImplementation.md
